page.title: 11TOWN'S EFFECT ON FARMING
page.content: As Bishop Auckland grows, houses and jobs are needed.Mr.Forster used to have{120-140 acres of good farmland.} In 1972 Henknowle{School}was built on one of his fields.In 1975, 52 acres were taken for the Henknowle{Housing {Estate}and 35 acres for the South Church{Industrial Estate.}Now he has lost more land for a new{by-pass {road.}The farm's future is uncertain. Since 1976 Mr.Forster has rented some poor quality{reclaimed colliery land } 1km east and southeast of the farm. He wishes the industrial estate had been built on the land instead. {Dogs}from the town worry the animals. Some do not put on weight. Some{sheep} have died.{Children}sometimes break the fences. The town means that Mr.Forster can{sell}his meat{locally. He says{farming}is the best job there is!
